message.name: RADIO_STATUS_EXTENSIONS
message.description: Additional link information for digital radios.
message.field: Local (message sender) recieved signal strength indication in decibels.
Local (message sender) signal to noise ratio in decibels.
Local (message sender) Modulation Coding Scheme index. This index uniquely describes the combination of number of spatial streams, modulation type and coding scheme.
Local (message sender) number of spatial streams.
Local (message sender) number of packets in buffer.
Local (message sender) percentage of time the radio is transmitting.

message.name: TRACKER_STATUS
message.description: Current status of the tracker. This message should be broadcast a low regular rate e.g. 1 Hz.
message.field: Number of objects currently detected.
The UID of the object currently being tracked.

message.name: TRACKER_DETECTION_2D
message.description: Contains information on an object detection in a video stream. Note that the video frame (image) ID must uniquely identify the same frame on all receiving devices.
message.field: Time stamp of the image.
Unique ID specifiying the video frame (image) in the message sender video stream.
Unique ID representing the object.
Unique ID specifiying the class of the object.
0: not tracked, 1: tracked.
Confidence score in the range of [0, 100] for the classifcation.
Relative image x coordinate (left to right axis) in the range of [0.00, 100.00] describing the top left corner of the bounding box .
Relative image y coordinate (top to bottom axis) in the range of [0.00, 100.00] describing the top left corner of the bounding box.
Relative image x coordinate (left to right axis) in the range of [0.00, 100.00] describing the bottom right corner of the bounding box.
Relative image y coordinate (top to bottom axis) in the range of [0.00, 100.00] describing the bottom left corner of the bounding box.
Latitude in WGS84 coordinate frame of the detected object. NAN if unknown.
Longitude in WGS84 coordinate frame of the detected object. NAN if unknown.
Altitude in EGM96 coordiante frame of the detected object. NAN if unknown.
North velocity of the object in global frame. NAN if unknown.
East velocity of the object in global frame. NAN if unknown.
Up velocity of the object in global frame. NAN if unknown.

message.name: JOYSTICK_STATE
message.description: State of all axes and buttons of a mavlink joystick
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.
Type of the MAV (quadrotor, helicopter, etc.), MAV_TYPE_JOYSTICK = 43
Value of each joystick axis
Value of each joystick button

message.name: JOYSTICK_INFORMATION
message.description: Information about a joystick. Can be requested with a MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE command.
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.
Name of the joystick vendor
Name of the joystick model
Number of joystick axes
Number of joystick buttons
Value of button when triggered
Value of button when release
Axis shift to positive direction, before multiplying and sending as integer in joystick status.
Axis value is first shifted, then multipled by this number before sending in the joystick state as an integer
Joystick definition version (iteration)

Joystick definition URI (if any, otherwise only basic functions will be available). HTTP- (http://) and MAVLink FTP- (mavlinkftp://) formatted URIs are allowed (and both must be supported by any GCS that implements the Camera Protocol). The definition file may be xz compressed, which will be indicated by the file extension .xml.xz (a GCS that implements the protocol must support decompressing the file). The string needs to be zero terminated.
